questions.name: If 1, 2, 3 and 4 are the roots of the equation x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d=0 , then a+2b+c is equal to
questions.nameText: If 1, 2, 3 and 4 are the roots of the equation x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d=0 , then a+2b+c is equal to
questions.solution:
If 1, 2, 3, 4 are the roots of given equation, then

x-1x-2x-3x-4=x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d

‚áíx2-3x+2x2-7x+12=x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d

‚áíx4-10x3+35x2-50x+24

=x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d

‚áía=-10, b=35, c=-50, d=24

‚à¥  a+2b+c=-10+2√ó35-50=10

Alternate,

Since, 1, 2, 3 and 4 are the roots of the equation

x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d=0 , then

1+a+b+c+d=0 ...(i)

16+8a+4b+2c+d=0 ...(ii)

81+27a+9b+3c+d=0 ...(iii)

And 256+64a+16b+4c+d=0 ...(iv)

On solving Eqs. (i), (ii), (iii) and (iv), we get

a=-10, b=35, c=-50,  d=24

Now, a+2b+c=-10+2√ó35+-50

=-10+70-50=10

Œ±+2 Œ±=-aa-band 2 Œ±2=1a-b

‚áía29a-b2=12(a-b)

‚áí2a2=9a-9b

‚áí2a2-9a+9b=0

‚áí81-72b‚â•0‚àµa‚ààR

‚áíb‚â§9/8

Hence, the greatest value of b is 98

=‚àëŒ±4Œ≤4Œ±4Œ≤4Œ≥4 ...((i)

[Œ±2Œ≤2+Œ≤2Œ≥2+Œ≥2Œ±2+2Œ±Œ≤Œ≥Œ±+Œ≤+Œ≥]

=Œ±4Œ≤4+Œ≤4Œ≥4+Œ≥4Œ±4+2Œ±4Œ≤2Œ≥2+2Œ±2Œ≤4Œ≥2+2Œ±2Œ≤2Œ≥4

= ‚àëŒ±4Œ≤4+2Œ±2Œ≤2Œ≥2(‚àëa)2-2‚àëŒ±Œ≤ 

= ‚àëŒ±4Œ≤4+2Œ±2Œ≤2Œ≥2 0-2√ó-7

‚áí  ‚àëŒ±4Œ≤4=-73-7+4=-3-73

On putting this value in Eq. (i) , we get

1Œ±4+1Œ≤4+1Œ≥4=-3-73-74=-3-7=37

‚áí  2+q-p=3

questions.name: If 1+x2=3x, ,then ‚àën=124xn-1xn2 is equal to
questions.nameText: If 1+x2=3x, ,then ‚àën=124xn-1xn2  is equal to
questions.solution:
We have,

1+x2=3x

‚áíx2-3 x+1=0 ‚áíx=3+i2=-i œâ,i œâ2

Clearly, -i œâ and i œâ2 are reciprocal of each other and the given expression does not alter by replacing x by 1x. So, we will compute its value for one of these two values of x

For x=i œâ2, we have

‚àën=124xn-1xn2=‚àën=124i œâ2n--i œân2

‚áí‚àën=124xn-1xn2=‚àën=124-1nœâ2n--1nœân2

‚áí‚àën=124xn-1xn2=‚àëk=18-13kœâ6k--13kœâ3k2+‚àëk=07-13k+1œâ6k+2--13k+1œâ3k+1+‚àëk=07-13k+2œâ6k+4--13k+2œâ3k+2

=‚àëk=18-13k1--13k2+‚àëk=07-13k+1œâ2--13k+1œâ2+‚àëk=07œâ--13k+2œâ22

=‚àëk=18-13k2-2-13k+‚àëk=07-13k+1œâ+œâ2-2-13k+1+‚àëk=07-13k+2œâ2+œâ-2-13k+2

=-4√ó4+‚àëk=07-13k-1-1+2-13k+2+‚àëk=07-13k+2{-1+2-13k+3}

=-16+-1√ó4+-3√ó4+{-3√ó4+4√ó-1}

= -48

questions.nameText:
l,m,n are the ùëùth, ùëûth and ùëüth terms of an GP and all 

Positive, thenlog‚Å°lp1log‚Å°mq1log‚Å°nr1  equals
questions.solution:
Let A and R be the first term and common ratio respectively.

‚à¥l=ARp-1

‚áílog‚Å°l=log‚Å°A+p-1log‚Å°R

m=ARq-1

‚áílog‚Å°m=log‚Å°A+q-1log‚Å°R

and n=ARr-1

‚áí log n=log‚Å°A+r-1log‚Å°R

Now, log‚Å°lp1log‚Å°mq1log‚Å°nr1=log‚Å°A+p-1log‚Å°Rp1log‚Å°A+q-1log‚Å°Rq1log‚Å°A+r-1log‚Å°Rr1

On multiplying R1,R2 andR3 byq-r,r-p andp-q and addingR1+R2+R3, we get

=q-r+r-p+p-q.log‚Å°A+{(q-r)(p-1)

+r-pq-1+p-q(r-1)} log‚Å° R

=0

questions.nameText:

questions.solution:
The system of equations

k x+y+z=1

x+k y+z=k

x+y+k z=k2

Is inconsistent, if

‚àÜ=k111k111k=0 and one of the ‚àÜ1,‚àÜ2‚àÜ3 is non-zero, where

‚àÜ1=111kk1k21k,‚àÜ2=k111k11k2k,‚àÜ3=k111kk11k2

We have, ‚àÜ=k+2k-12,‚àÜ1=-k+1k-12

‚àÜ2=-kk-12, ‚àÜ3=k+12k-12

Clearly, for k=-2, we have

‚àÜ=0 and ‚àÜ1,‚àÜ2,‚àÜ3 are non-zero-. Therefore, k=-2 ,=

questions.nameText: If A and B are matrices of the same order, then A+B2=A2+2¬†AB+B2  is possible, ,iff
questions.solution:

‚áîA+BA+B=A2+2 AB+B2

‚áîA2+A B+B A+B2=A2+2 A B+B2

‚áîA B=B A

Hence, A+B2=A2+2 AB+B2‚áîA B=B A
